entry.title: NotifierCollision: Move notifier collision code to a different class
entry.content:
Move all the notifier collision code to a separate class. This makes the

code in AshMessagePopupCollection more organized and easier to read.

This CL just moves code without adding any new logic.

entry.title: Fix undefined as second argument of URLSearchParams#has,delete
entry.content:
Due to the usage of Runtime Enabled features to control the impl of

URLSearchParams#has and delete when called with second argument as

undefined ex: has('a', undefined) caused errorenous results hence moved

the feature flag checking into the C++ code instead of the blink idl

definition.

entry.content:
After saving the actual baseline values from OpenType Table to

simple_font_data,

fixed the failures in draw.baselines.hanging/ideographic.

entry.title: Fix prerender BackNavigationOfCloneWebContents test
entry.content:
The test originally landed with an assumption about BrowsingInstance

swapping that doesn't hold for some configurations. In particular,

completely disabling bfcache affects the proactive swap logic.



We now have the test consider both cases of the initial navigations

swapping or not swapping BrowsingInstances, and adjust the

expectations accordingly.

entry.title: [apps] Pull out user link capturing throttle logic for cross-platform
entry.content:
This change refactors the user link capturing logic inside of both

the AppsNavigationThrottle and the ChromeOsAppsNavigationThrottle into

the LinkCapturingNavigationThrottle with a Delegate class for per-

platform specialization.



This split divorces the core link capturing logic from both

App Service and web apps systems so it can be bound to either as a

provider of apps with URL scopes.



The dependency graph will be:

ChromeContentBrowserClient

/ | \

v | v

WebAppLinkCapturing (next) | AppServiceLinkCapturing

\ | /

v v v

LinkCapturingNavigationThrottle



Design doc: go/user-link-capturing-throttle



The next patch will create the throttle used for non-CrOS platforms.



Bug: b/269773608

Change-Id: I693ab4b78bd4ed61ba4e641b5f167d64c5a4969c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4727423

Reviewed-by: Yuichiro Hanada

entry.title: [mac immersive fs] fix web dialogs positioning
entry.content:
The dialog positioning code assumes that the top container and the

content container are in the same widget. This is not true in immersive

fullscreen where the top container is in a separate overlay widget.



The CL

- fixes the calculation in BrowserViewLayout. The offset should be

relative to the top of the dialog host widget (i.e. overlay widget).

- invalidates the browser view layout on overlay widget move to

reposition dialogs.



Bug: 1469898

entry.title: Suppress cmd windows during Windows host installation and repair
entry.content:
This CL addresses the annoying window flicker which occurs when

installing the Windows CRD host. The fix is to use the CaQuietExec

action to run the commands, this action has a 32-bit and 64-bit

variant so the WXS was updated to use the proper action based on

the platform bitness.



More information about CaQuietExec can be found here:

https://wixtoolset.org/docs/v3/customactions/qtexec/



Note that newer Wix toolsets use the WixQuietExec variant which is

apparently just a renamed version of the action I'm introducing.

If we upgrade our Wix toolset, we'll need to change the names of

the actions here or we'll likely see them start failing.



Bug: b/297319930

entry.title: [SBv5] Fall back to SafetyNet if the error from SafeBrowsing is non-recoverable
entry.content:
Add three new values in SafeBrowsingApiLookupResult:

* FAILURE_API_CALL_TIMEOUT

* FAILURE_API_UNSUPPORTED

* FAILURE_API_NOT_AVAILABLE

They will be set in a follow-up CL in the internal repo.



Consider FAILURE_API_UNSUPPORTED and FAILURE_API_NOT_AVAILABLE as

non-recoverable. They are thrown if 1) GMSCore is not installed on

device or 2) GMSCore has outdated version or 3) Current build doesn't

have permission to call the API.



Once Chrome receives a non-recoverable failure, following calls to

SafeBrowsing API will fall back to SafetyNet until browser restarts.

This is because a non-recoverable failure is unlikely to be resolved

while the APP is running. Checking SafetyNet can reduce the time users

need to wait and is more likely to be successful. See

go/safebrowsing-api-error-handling-in-chrome for details.



Bug: 1444511

entry.title: [Start Surface Refactor] Fix missing layout lifecycle steps
entry.content:
A Layout subclass is supposed to call doneShowing/doneHiding when it

finishes show/startHiding.



Right now the only place this is automatically called is in

onUpdate with completed animators, which doesn't happen for

StartSurfaceHomeLayout [1]. The other caller is skipped for

Start Surface [2]. This means no finished showing or hiding signal are

sent for Start Surface which ToolbarManager (at least) is listening for

to update the toolbar correctly.



Since Start Surface show/hide has no animation it should follow

OverviewListLayout [3] and invoke doneShowing/doneHiding at the end of

show/startHiding (change in this CL). TabSwitcherLayout and

StartSurfaceAndTabSwitcherLayout don't have this issue because they

call doneShowing()/doneHiding() after their animations complete.



This bug is actually the probable root cause of a number of

recent issue including the regression that caused the revert

(and eventual reland) of:

https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4777839



This also allows us to unconditionally call hideOverview when handling

an intent which is helpful.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/compositor/layouts/LayoutManagerImpl.java;drc=d76bbe1456ab0713d884cc51742ba565fb808cf8;l=535



[2] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/compositor/layouts/LayoutManagerChromePhone.java;drc=d76bbe1456ab0713d884cc51742ba565fb808cf8;l=126



[3] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:chrome/android/java/src/org/chromium/chrome/browser/accessibility_tab_switcher/OverviewListLayout.java;drc=d76bbe1456ab0713d884cc51742ba565fb808cf8;l=173

entry.title: [Element Capture #4] Add element capture command line hack
entry.content:
This Patch:

This patch contains a hacky command line flag that allows for

experimental testing of the backing code for element capture.



In order to test the element capture backend implementation, start

Chrome with the following flags:



--enable-blink-features=ElementCapture

--enable-features=UseElementInsteadOfRegionCapture



A full test page is available at:

https://element-capture-demo.glitch.me/



The Project:

Element level capture is a new mode of tab capture being implemented that allows developers to capture subsections of the DOM, meaning that occluding content is never captured (unless the currently existing region capture mode). For more information, Googlers may visit: go/element-capture



All developers are welcome to visit the W3 spec page at:

https://screen-share.github.io/element-capture/



Coming Up Next:

1. Working with eladlon@ to replace the hack with the proper

restrictTo API.

2. Bug fixing and stabilizations.

entry.title: Remove duplicate dnd functionality between Web and Renderer prefs
entry.content:
WebPreferences::navigate_on_drag_drop and

RendererPreferences::can_accept_load_drops attempted to implement the

same functionality, which is to disable navigation via drag n drop of a

URI. The WebPreferences version didn't work as well because it only

blocked the navigation inside the web contents, but still managed

to allow a new tab to be opened to about:blank#blocked, and did not

affect the drag operation calculation (which affects the displayed

cursor and affects event routing). Thus, the WebPreferences version is

deleted and its only client, which is BrowserPluginGuest, is updated

to use the RendererPreferences setting.



Bug: 1475698,733996

entry.title: Allow high efficiency IPH to show when mode is off
entry.content:
Currently we show the high efficiency IPH when the user reaches a tab,

memory or jank threshold and the user is in the high efficiency default

mode. This is fine for now since by default, high efficiency mode is

off. However, if the high efficiency were to ever to be default on the

IPH can potentially be triggered even though the user already have the

mode on.



This CL narrows the eligibility of showing the high efficiency slightly

so that in addition to the user reaching a threshold and using the

default mode, high efficiency mode will also need to be off.



Fixed: 1459343

entry.title: Pass native AutocompleteMatch directly to UpdateDestinationUrl
entry.content:
This change paves the way for introduction of horizontal rendering

groups. We pass the entire native AutocompleteMatch to

UpdateMatchDestinationUrlWithQueryFormulationTime.



The match is no longer copied; instead its destination url is updated

in place.



The change enables voice queries to receive query formulation time:

- voice queries are supplied from VoiceSuggestProvider (have native

object),

- we explicitly check for queries not originating from native (or

those that no longer are related to their native counterparts).

- we no longer check for an index of a query to be updated, because it

is no longer relevant (if we have native object, we really don't

care what its index is).



Bug: 1474087

entry.title: Reland "service worker: ServiceWorkerContextWrapper to maintain browser context"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 02c2da9705688b2bed815164a5dce5d27b5aa722.



Reason for revert: Issue identified in https://crbug.com/1473204#c6.



Original change's description:

> Revert "service worker: ServiceWorkerContextWrapper to maintain browser context"

>

> This reverts commit b53126e0ddd699682d688e18dd1f5aa18aec69a3.

>

> Reason for revert: Causing consistent test failures on Linux Tests (Wayland) builder

> i.e. https://ci.chromium.org/ui/p/chromium/builders/ci/Linux%20Tests%20(Wayland)/41977/test-results?sortby=&groupby=

>

> Original change's description:

> > service worker: ServiceWorkerContextWrapper to maintain browser context

> >

> > This CL makes ServiceWorkerContextWrapper to maintain the browser

> > context by itself rather than having the dependency of

> > ServiceWorkerProcessManager. This is to avoid the complication when

> > destroying its own members. For example, ServiceWorkerContextCore

> > requires a valid browser context during destruction and

> > ServiceWorkerContextWrapper ends up needing to be careful on the

> > sequence of shutting down ServiceWorkerProcessManager and destroying

> > ServiceWorkerContextCore.

> >

> > Bug: 1473204

> > Change-Id: I9a8a82f3e228fda41041be74f88b308e776d8f53

entry.title: Revert "Stop geolocation watch updates upon permission revocation"
entry.content:
This reverts commit d02d575ab500ac29d0bad966fd53a97fe0b0f61a.



Reason for revert: returns "permission was revoked" error even after

permission is granted (crbug.com/1475743)



Original change's description:

> Stop geolocation watch updates upon permission revocation

>

> Previously, once a site obtained a geolocation watch (either through an already existing grant or through a new permission prompt flow), it kept receiving location updates in the registered watch callback within the same session (i.e. for as long as the user didn't close the tab or performed a navigation). This remained the case, even after the grant was revoked. This CL fixes this behaviour.

entry.title: fix the crash of resize shadow
entry.content:
This cl fixed the crash of resize shadow. The crash happens

because resize shadow observes a color provider source owned by

the root window. When the root window and its color provider source

are destroying, OnColorProviderSourceChanged will also be called.

ResizeShadow will get a null color provider source. To fix it,

we only update resize shadow layer when the color provider source

is not null.



We also overlooked a case that when the window is parented to

another root window. We should update the color provider source

in this case.



Test: ResizeShadowAndCursorTest.NoCrashOnRootWindowChange

Bug: 1475327

Change-Id: I5043cf576e5edf9c5d256317d2387bd41884ba3c

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4809479

entry.title: Disable ui.ChromeCrashNotLoggedIn.browser_crashpad
entry.content:
ui.ChromeCrashNotLoggedIn.browser_crashpad is failing in the chrome

builder but nowhere else. Repeated attempts to reproduce the issue with

the exact same version have not succeeded.



At least one theory is that there is something specific to the chrome

builder causing the problem. Unblock that builder for now. If the

ChromeOS builders start failing, I'll remove the failing check

completely -- this a real problem but not severe enough that we should

block releases for it. But even just knowing that the ChromeOS builders

fail would be a good data point. (Also, knowing which boards are failing

would help.)



BUG=b:296821415

entry.title: Update clang-tidy docs to fix argument passing.
entry.content:
When using `tidy_checks` if the first part of the value is `-*` then

this gets turned into an argument by `argparse`. If you escape to be

`\-*` then it gets passed through as escaped and seems to be ignored by

clang-tidy. This CL updates the documentation to use the

`tidy_checks='-*'` version so argparse recognises it as the value and

passes through correctly.

entry.title: Correct text decoration spelling- and grammar-error
entry.content:
It was resolved that test-decoration-line: spelling-error and grammar-error

should render identically to the system default spelling and grammar

error markers, ignoring other properties set for the text decoration.



See https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/7522



Four tests started failing because they were trying to set

text-decoration-color inside a ::spelling-error or ::grammar-error

pseudo. This fails because the default line type for those

pseudos is spelling-error or grammar-error. A spec issue has been filed to get the desired behavior determined. Meanwhile the tests

have been modified to set the line type in addition to the color.



Also enable the tests with fuzzy matching to account for painting order

differences. Decorations paint under text, markers paint over text.



Bug: 1466286

Change-Id: I78fda3563b375c5b4730de7249d04e1609b975e2

This reverts commit eeec896f0307b04df04c7e210f57701d3d97133c.



Reason for revert: This is not feasible for chromium tests as the data won't be accessible by other app.

For example, chrome_public_test_apk rely on ChromiumNetTestSupport.apk to launch a HTTPS server. The server will load a cert pem file[1] which locates in test data dir "chromium_tests_root". It will hit a permission error if the test data dir is put under chrome_public_test_apk's data dir.



[1] https://source.chromium.org/chromium/chromium/src/+/main:net/test/android/javatests/src/org/chromium/net/test/EmbeddedTestServer.java;drc=09b37686fd6494b4bc7e90f577f2d8e2712e723b;l=537-538



Original change's description:

> Android: Store test data in an app's data directory

>

> This CL adds the --store-data-in-app-directory android test harness.

> Android versions R+ now have scoped storage, meaning apps cannot

> access all data on the external storage drive. Therefore we will

> have to store test data in the test app's data directory.

>

> Bug: 1324649

> Change-Id: Ia539865de6e187efe23c048e9da21f3030c2593e

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/3708044

> Reviewed-by: Richard Coles

> Reviewed-by: Peter Wen

> Commit-Queue: Rakib Hasan

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1031519}



Bug: 1324649

entry.title: Enforce clean AX trees at the end of @WAIT-FOR and @NO-LOAD-EXPECTED tests
entry.content:
The HiddenTable dump tree test was flaky because @WAIT-FOR doesn't wait

for the AX tree to be clean before dumping. If you look at some of the

failure outputs for the test, you can notice we got in a weird

intermediary state where the AX tree has a "Done" text node, but

the table rows weren't removed yet. For example, look at this linked

failure and Ctrl+F for "done":

https://chromium-swarm.appspot.com/task?id=62cebbe44f4a3611



Now, @WAIT-FOR tests will wait for the AX tree to be clean in all

frames, except frames skipped by the @NO-LOAD-EXPECTED directive. This

fixes the flaky HiddenTable test and should also help in the UIA test

flakiness investigation.



Bug: 1454778, 1428967

entry.title: usb: Introduce ServiceWorkerUsbDelegateObserver for WebUsbService
entry.content:
This change introduces ServiceWorkerUsbDelegateObserver as a broker

between UsbDelegate and WebUsbService. It is not covered in this CL yet,

but this class is set to be responsible to keep track what

ServiceWorkerRegistration should respond to USB events and wake up the

service worker if it is not in running state. The full functionality

will be completed by the following CL.

entry.title: [Glanceables] Elide long task titles to fit within bounds
entry.content:
Change the tasks_title_view_ to use a BoxLayout and set its container's

flex rule so that it can can scale to a size smaller than its

preferred size, causing the labels to elide.



Add margin to the right of the title, according to spec, so the

elided text does not go to the edge of the parent view.

entry.title: Support notifications moving between dispatchers on Mac.
entry.content:
When some attribute of a notification changes such that it would be

shown by a different dispatcher while its ID stays the same (for

example a change to the `require_interaction` flag, or a change from

not being associated with a web app to being associated with one)

we need to make sure to close the notification in the old dispatcher

to ensure no confusing duplicate notifications.



Bug: 938661

entry.title: [CVV Storage] Refactor OnCreditCardFetched function
entry.content:
1. Remove CVC parameter

2. Set CVC in CreditCard Object before calling OnCreditCardFetched

function. Impacted flows: ServerCard CVC Auth, ServerCard Fido Auth,

VirtualCard Otp Auth.

3. Retrieve CVC from CreditCard Object instead of CVV parameter



Without CVC parameter, we are not confused with whether it's server card

cvc or local card cvc.



15 results of onCreditCardFethced function usage:

https://source.chromium.org/search?

q=oncreditcardfetched&ss=chromium%2Fchromium%2Fsrc&start=1



Will refactor CachedServerCardInfo,

VirtualCardManualFallbackBubbleOptions,

OnDeviceAuthenticationResponseForFilling in follow up CL:

https://bugs.chromium.org/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1473481

entry.title: selectlist: Use manual slotting
entry.content:
The new selectlist architecture will use manual imperative slotting

instead of named slotting like other builtin HTML elements. This patch

changes selectlist to use imperative slotting while still supporting

named slotting. This way we can build the new architecture without

migrating all of the tests etc.

entry.title: [webauthn] Handle hybrid on win for GPM passkeys
entry.content:
Chrome delegates hybrid to the native Windows API when supported.

However, this is not wired for synced GPM passkeys yet. Let Chrome

handle hybrid on Windows if the list synced passkeys feature is enabled.



This *should* hopefully fix three bugs on Win11 v6+:

* A crash when tapping a GPM passkey on autofill.

* GPM passkeys on autofill not displaying the phone name.

* GPM passkeys not showing up on modal UI.

On iOS 17, lookUp menu is hidden when selection is too long

which hides partial translate.

Move the translate and Search actions in their own submenu.

Consequence is that those action will move before the lookup

actions and will be available on long selection and on

specific type selections (like URL).

=> Reordering: https://crrev.com/c/4803716

- Reenable: https://crrev.com/i/6370990

entry.title: [uia] Added new UIA-only value for AXEmbeddedObjectBehavior
entry.content:
This CL introduces a new enum value for AXEmbeddedObjectBehavior

called `kUIAExposeCharacterForTextContent`

to fix issues we have run into.

These issues stem from scenarios where UIA APIs are used, and we end up

going through a code path that uses IA2 logic.



For instance, the Macros on AXPlatformNodeTextrangeProviderWin make

sure positions are valid by calling `AXPosition::AsValidPosition`.

In our specific case, we would go down a path where inside this func

we then call `CreatePositionAtEndOfAnchor` which then attempts

to create a TextPosition with offset = `MaxTextOffset()`.



Within `MaxTextOffset()` we fall into the scenario where

`GetAnchor()->GetHypertext().length()` is called. However, this is IA2

specific logic, and it is being used by UIA APIs which lead to wrong

behavior.



As such, this CL introduces `kUIAExposeCharacter` which is leads to

behavior similar to `kExposeCharacter` simply without the IA2 specific

logic and calculations.



Moreover, this CL also introduces new logic to

`TextRangeProvider::FindText`. We used to previously subtract

the number of appended newlines to the found range, however this

was not correct behaviour when in cases where the newlines appended

were after the range found, which then made it so we unnecessarily

shortened the range. This CL changes `AXRange::GetText` so that

instead of getting the number of appended newlines as an out parameter

it now gets a vector of the indices in the range where those appended

newlines were added as an out parameter. This way, FindText can

shorten the range only when the appended newlines are within the

relevant range.



Change-Id: Iac6369c1e8012e446807ba02720f46a6e2c10972

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4786934

Commit-Queue: Javier Contreras

Reviewed-by: Benjamin Beaudry

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1187935}

entry.title: [APS] Fix omnibox not gaining focus on the NTP when a hardware keyboard
entry.content:
is connected



Currently, the omnibox focus set by

LocationBarMediator#showUrlBarCursorWithoutFocusAnimations() is cleared

due to the unfocus logic in LocationBarMediator#setUrl() because of two

invocations of setUrl() that occur after the call to the former when the

NTP is opened - at the time of the first invocation the NTP URL is empty

and therefore the omnibox is unintentionally unfocused.



This CL attempts to remove the unfocus logic from setUrl() to overcome

this and control focus / unfocus for this use case from one point -

ToolbarManager#maybeShowCursorInLocationBar() will be repurposed to do

this.



Bug: 1445822

Change-Id: Ie83bc518f2513c45b416d8b1cf0ce7f9baec1ac7

entry.title: webauthn: don't restart requests after non-automatic dispatch to iCKC.
entry.content:
The `priority_mechanisms_index_` member was not ephemeral state, but

should have been. Without this change, if iCKC was auto-dispatched

initially, every time the user cancels it we'll restart the request, but

that should only happen once.
